@graph.caseNumber: Consumer Goods Pricing Act of 1975, 89 Stat. 801
@graph.parties: Department of Justice and the FTC
@graph.reasoning: Congress consciously extended Dr. Miles’ per se rule.
This study equates the failure of plaintiffs to allege collusion with the absence of collusion.
This study develops a theoretical model “under the assumption that [resale price maintenance] is efﬁciency-enhancing.”
Newer studies that show that resale price maintenance sometimes brings consumer beneﬁts.
